posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
A ranger in a lvl 30 cap cannot get both BoE and ED. BoE requires 21 ranger lvls and ED requires at least SD 10, so you are 1 lvl above the cap.

Ranger/FTR/WM has no tumble and no UMD. I'd rather go with Ranger/FTR/Rogue, STR based, human (or half orc) and with a lvl split like Ranger 23/FTR 4/Rogue 3. DW is possible in light armor and with some dex buffing (you've got cat's grace in your spellbook already) without having to spend extra feats on it.

You need focus on a melee weapon to get CoT levels, that's why. that weapon can't be unarmed.

FTR, unarmed focus doesn't work while shifted. You say you are new to this, so let me tell you something that may disappoint you a bit but that we all know and that you need to know as well:

THE CHARACTER SHEET LIES!!

One of the lies is that it gives you the impression that Weapon Focus Unarmed works while shifted, but it doesn't.
Size modifiers to AB and AC are also not shown in you sheet. Dragons, for instance, are huge creatures, so they get an AB and AC size modifier of -2 which is not shown in the sheet. Furthermore, the Dragon Claws you attack with are counted as +6 weapons for all purposes, which is also not shown in the character sheet. This means that your AB and AC in Dragon Shape are actually +4 and -2 respectively from what is shown in your sheet. The +4 is because you need to add +6 from the dragon claws -2 from size modifier.

Take it EZ!

P.S.: Does anyone know the FULL LIST of the Character Sheet lies? What it counts and what it doesn't? Maybe someone can post a topic in the General Discussion forum to help out the newer players. I would do it myself, but RL is kinda hard right now (haven't even been able to play NWN in 2 weeks) and I'm not sure I know all of the lies it tells.

Well, I'd say scimitar for onehander. In many environments a longsword trumps, because there are more good weapons availible. You should go for weapons with bonuses other than enchantment. Bard has both Greater Magic Weapon and Keen edge on his list.

Expertise is just something I like in my melee casters, to get a bit extra AC while casting, or perhaps when you activate song. You don't combat cast much as bard, but sometimes you need the ImpInvis or Darkness. Expertise is, although nice, definitely not make-or-break. You don't have IKD in there, and not any save bolsters f.ex. Sometimes I use Expertise in a group just to stay alive so the others benefit from my song also.
